resources.string: Frequency vs. Recorder Buffer Period (ms) Plot
Frequency vs. Player Buffer Period (ms) Plot
Test settings will appear here after the first test is run

Round-trip audio latency testing app
 using the Dr. Rick O'Rang audio loopback dongle.
 Authors: Ricardo Garcia (rago), Tzu-Yin Tai, and Brandon Swanson
 Open source project on:
 https://github.com/gkasten/drrickorang
 References:
 https://source.android.com/devices/audio/latency.html
 https://goo.gl/dxcw0d


 adb parameters: all parameters are optional. If not specified, defaults will be used.
 -ei SF 												 ####		 sampling frequency 
 -es Filename 							 ssss			 output filename 
 -ei MicSource 							 ####		 microphone source
 																 0: DEFAULT
 																 1: MIC
 																 2: CAMCORDER
 																 3: VOICE_RECOGNITION
 																 4: VOICE_COMMUNICATION
 -ei AudioThread 					 ####		 Audio Thread Type
 																 0: Java
 																 1: Native (JNI)
 -ei AudioLevel 						 ####		 Audio Level [0:15]
 -ei RecorderBuffer 				 ####		 Recorder Buffer Frames
 -ei PlayerBuffer 						 ####		 Player Buffer Frames
 -ei TestType 								 ####		 Audio Test Type
 																 222: Latency Test
 																 223: Buffer Test
 -ei BufferTestDuration 	 ####		 Buffer Test Duration 
 -ei NumLoadThreads 	 ####		 Number of Simulated Load Threads (0 - 20) 
 -ei CI 	 ####		 Channel Index for USB Audio (0 - 8) 
 -ez CaptureSysTrace 	 ####		 enable/disable systrace and bugreport capturing 
 -ez CaptureWavs 	 ####		 enable/disable .wav file snippets capturing 
 -ei NumCaptures 	 ####		 Number of systrace/bugreport and/or wav snippets to capture 
 -ei WaveDuration 	 ####		 Duration in seconds of captured wave files 



Example: adb shell am start -n org.drrickorang.loopback/.LoopbackActivity 
 --ei SF 48000 --es FileName output --ei MicSource 3 --ei AudioThread 1 --ei AudioLevel 12 --ei TestType 223 --ei BufferTestDuration 5 --ez CaptureWavs true --ei NumCaptures 5
Calibrate sound level before latency test (experimental)
Number of Systrace/BugReport and or Wav Snippets to Capture
Frames to ignore at the start of the latency test (Max: %1$d)

To use this feature it is necessary to launch a shell script on the Android device using ADB shell. This script is responsible for launching an asynchronous Systrace and writing its buffer to file when signaled by the Loopback App. 

 At the completion of the audio glitch/buffer test the Loopback App will signal the script to exit so the script must be started before each test. 

 The Loopback App places this script on the Android device when launched at 
 /sdcard/Loopback/loopback_listener 


Trace Categories: The loopback_listener script takes as arguments the categories to be tracked in the Systrace. By default the sched and audio categories are included. For a list of available categories see
 developer.android.com/tools/help/systrace.html 


Example invocation:
 adb shell "sh /sdcard/Loopback/loopback_listener load am"

This feature is highly experimental. It will try various volume levels until it picks one that it thinks is optimal. It has only been tested with the loopback plug and may fail completely in open air.
